body.p: Mr Garnett observes that the application of the measurement principle that an acquirer should measure the components of a business combination, including non‑controlling interests, at their acquisition‑date fair values results in the recognition of not only the purchased goodwill attributable to the acquirer as a result of the acquisition transaction, but also the goodwill attributable to the non‑controlling interest in the acquiree. This is often referred to as the ‘full goodwill’ method.
